Summary A postdoctoral position is available in the laboratory of Dr. Javier Medina, located in the Department of Neuroscience at Baylor College of Medicine. The applicant will work on an ongoing research project at the intersection of neuroscience and artificial intelligence. The project is funded by the NIH BRAIN Initiative, and it takes advantage of high-density Neuropixels probes with nearly 1,000 switchable sensors to record and analyze the population activity in the brain of mice performing supervised learning tasks. The goal of this project is to decipher the algorithms that the brain uses to learn, and to develop artificial neural networks to test these algorithms in real-world applications. Job Purpose Postdoctoral Associates are trainees working in an apprenticeship mode in preparation for a career as a scientific professional. Job Duties Plans, directs and conducts research experiments. Data analysis. Publishes results in research journals. Minimum Qualifications MD or Ph.D. in Basic Science, Health Science, or a related field. No experience is required. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of Matlab (or other programming languages like Python or Igor). Electrophysiology experience (in vivo or in vitro) is desirable, but not required. PhD in Neuroscience. 0 â 5 years of postdoc experience. Baylor College of Medicine is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Equal Access Employer.  7384 CA; PD

job_title: Technical Solutions Engineer, Big Data, Google Cloud
job_Description: Minimum qualifications:          Bachelor's degree in the field of Science, Technology, Engineering, Math or equivalent practical experience.      Experience reading or debugging code in one or more of the following: Java, C, C++, .NET, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript.      Experience in advocating for customer needs.        Preferred qualifications:          Experience with distributed, columnar and/or analytic oriented databases or distributed data processing frameworks.      Experience with open source distributed storage and processing utilities in the Apache Hadoop family and/or workflow orchestration products.      Experience with machine learning technologies, including developing and/or training models or implementing solutions which rely on invoking such models.      Excellent troubleshooting, attention to detail, and communication skills in a fast-paced setting.      Understanding of TCP/IP concepts, Unix/Linux basic administration and commands, and basic web technologies.      Background in data analytics, warehousing, ETL development, data science or other Big Data applications.            About the job      The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business â all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers â developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies â see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.       Our Technical Solutions Engineers lead and own our largest and most important customer issues in addition to providing level two support to our other support teams. You will be a part of a global team that provides support to help customers seamlessly make the switch to Google Cloud.       You'll troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and when needed, coding/scripting. Our Technical Solutions team is focused on the customer, and you will help drive the success of Google Cloud by understanding and advocating for our customers issues.      Google Cloud accelerates organizationsâ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Googleâs cutting-edge technology â all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.            Responsibilities           Manage the customerâs problem through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of investigation tools to increase productivity for customer issues on Google Cloud Platform products.       Develop an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported issues, and building tools for faster diagnosis.       Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in engineering, sales, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.       Work as part of a team of Engineers/Consultants that globally ensure customer support. This will include a need to sometimes work non-standard work hours or shifts.       Understand customer issues and advocate for their needs with cross-functional teams, like product and engineering, to find ways to improve the product and drive high-quality production.         Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

POSITION TITLE:  QA Team Lead      Supervised by:  Director, Software Development      Supervises:  IT QA Analysts, Software Development Engineers in Test      FLSA Status:  Full time, Exempt      Location:  HQ in Brecksville, OH; this position can be remote / home based      POSITION SUMMARY.      The QA Team Lead manages processes and personnel to conduct automated and manual quality assurance testing in MediQuant's Agile Development Team. In this role, The QA Team Lead develops effective and efficient methods, maintains documentation throughout the QA process, validates and measures the quality of MediQuant's Software Products.      The QA Team Lead conducts rigorous testing throughout the development process, identifies potential issues, and resolves them collaboratively. The QA Team Lead is also responsible for developing and implementing fixes and improvements, working with their team and others to deploy updates and resolve issues that arise during the QA process.      The QA Team Lead works to ensure whole-team ownership of the appropriate unit, integration, and UI test coverage. They are data-driven and experienced in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.      JOB DUTIES and ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS.  A qualified individual must be able to perform these essential functions of the job as listed, with or without accommodation. (An Asterisk (*) Identifies an Essential Function).           Leads and develops a team of QA professionals to operate efficiently and effectively. (*)              Collaborate with the Director of Software Development to establish and evolve formal QA processes, ensuring that the team uses industry-accepted best practices.         Manage the day-to-day activities of QA team members.         Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products.         Oversee all aspects of quality assurance, including establishing metrics, applying industry best practices, and developing new tools and processes to meet quality goals.         Assess current testing needs and schedules to determine staffing needs.             Act as the key point of contact for all aspects of QA, providing QA services and coordinating QA resources internally and externally. (*)              Review user stories, requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.         Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test cases with test coverage metrics.         Track quality assurance metrics and reporting, like defect densities, escaped defects, and open defect counts.         Design, develop and execute test automation code.         Act as the primary code reviewer for other testers.         Triage defects by evaluating impact and severity and provides recommendations for release timing.             Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to create high-quality, innovative software products and tools (*).              Liaise with internal teams (e.g., developers and product managers) to identify system requirements.         Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities.         Perform thorough iterative and regression release testing.         Identify, record, document thoroughly, track and re-test defects.         Create and maintain test environments for software testing.             Assists with Recruiting, Performance Management, and Staff Development. (*)              Collaborates with Human Resources and direct supervisor during the interview and hiring processes.         Consistently aligns recruiting activities with established Human Resources processes.         Actively works to fill open positions in a timely and reasonable manner.         Lead and mentor QA team members and stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies.         New Hire Onboarding â Prepares new hire 30-60-90-day training plan and integrates feedback into daily, weekly, and monthly one-on-one meetings.         Prepares initial feedback for team performance reviews.         Conduct regularly scheduled meetings with individual team members to review their work status,clarify role expectations, provide feedback, identify training needs, discuss growth plans, and match their skill sets with new and challenging projects.         Coaching and Mentoring â Creates a learning environment and encourages staff to participate in skill development. Supports staff efforts to engage in self-directed training, whether company-provided, college coursework, professional activities or professional certifications.                QUALIFICATIONS      Competencies.           Developing and maintaining custom testing frameworks       Azure DevOps and Git Experience       Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes       Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases       Hands-on experience with Unit, Integration, and Automated UI test creation, evaluation, and maintenance       Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting       Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process          Required Education and Experience.           BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject       Proven work experience of 7+ Years in software quality assurance       Must have Selenium + C# hands on Experience of 5+ Years       Experience with continuous integration, continuous deployments, and release pipelines          Additional Eligibility Qualifications.           Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus       Experience in full System Development Life Cycle       Experience with agile development a plus       Prefer knowledge of HIPAA regulations involving PHI and HITEC       Prefer previous experience in Hospital & Healthcare          POSITION SUPERVISES. Job Location      This position will be on-site in either San Antonio, TX or Boulder, CO*     Summary Do you love robots and product? Look no further.   Plus One Robotics stands at the cusp of a new era in automated warehouses: our solutions are designed to alleviate labor shortages while improving throughput as consumer online spending continues to explode. Our robots are used by the biggest players in parcel shipping. If boxes have ever piled up outside your doorstep, thereâs a good chance our robots have touched at least one of them.   We seek a driven and intellectually voracious product manager who is equally comfortable with engineers and business executives to build out the platform undergirding our customer-facing products to accelerate the growth of the company.   The work will be challenging but itâll be a chapter of your career that will make for a great story.   About the Job   Essential Functions   For those who don't mind a steep learning curve, the right person for this role will enjoy wide latitude and broad scope:   Milestone delivery:   Manage the multi-team development of a robotic platform by understanding business requirements, anticipating bottlenecks and dependencies, managing changes, removing roadblocks, mitigating risks, and building consensus with cross-functional stakeholders. Roadmap design:   Identify, prioritize, and advocate for the most impactful opportunities to improve the efficiency and quality of longer-term customer-facing product development. Data-driven decisions:   Define and assess metrics to guide platform development. Engineering translation:   Collaborate with engineers and customer-facing product managers to write technical requirements docs to help engineers understand product specifications. Foundation building:   Make tradeoffs between satisfying near-term needs while building a platform that can support growth at scale across many applications.   Qualifications   Qualifications   Our customers will learn about how best to incorporate new technology into their physical spaces while deriving immediate concrete value from their purchase of the robot. You will pull out all the stops to ensure the success of our customers â some of the most prominent brands in the country â and use their feedback to further improve our product.   Youâre the ideal candidate if:  Youâre responsive and responsible:   you commit to deadlines and err on the side of over-communication. Youâre analytical and data-driven:   p-values and pivot tables are old buddies with whom you donât mind spending an afternoon distilling data into an insightful story. Youâre versatile and goal-oriented:   you can drive various teams with competing priorities. Youâre collaborative and results-oriented:   you understand both that you need to crack a few eggs to make an omelet but also that you catch more flies with honey than vinegar. You have an eye for detail and are an excellent writer:   you notice when someone writes âPick Oneâ instead of âPickOneâ and it bothers you when others donât get it right. You're self-sufficient and whip-smart:   you get things done and learn what you donât know. Youâre organized:   you can juggle and make progress on multiple initiatives simultaneously. Youâre empathetic and user-focused:   you understand that you may not be the target audience and you are unrelenting in holding a high bar for the user experience. Youâre creative and a strategic thinker:   you understand and can shape the team around the right level of process while displaying excellent judgment to achieve both short-term and long-term goals. You value first-hand on-the-ground experience and not just taking someone elseâs word for it: youâre happy to observe and take notes on the robot picking up packages all day and jump on a plane as needed to fully internalize customer workflows. Youâre a technophile:   you donât have to be a former engineer, but youâve dabbled in code and are eager to brush up your experience in unfamiliar fields, whether itâs hardware, perception, machine learning, or others. Youâre high-integrity, ambitious, and play âinfiniteâ games:   you understand that careers are long, that people and values come first, and that there's a difference between being liked and being respected. Youâre passionate and clear-eyed when it comes to robots:   you understand that thereâs a gap between technological reality and media-driven expectations and are excited about the opportunity to move the industry forward by whatever means necessary, even if it isnât glamorous.   Desired Education and Experience   Even if you donât check all the boxes, feel free to include a short paragraph explaining why you would be the best candidate regardless.   Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.g. computer science, engineering, physics, math, etc.) or equivalent practical experience 5 years of experience in product management, especially in enterprise platforms or robotics Experience in one or more of the following:   cloud infrastructure, on-prem enterprise software, machine learning, developer APIs, warehouse logistics Working knowledge of best practices in Agile, engineering processes, and preparing a startup for growth   Additional Eligibility Qualifications   Must have a valid passport. Must be able to travel both nationally and internationally.   Supervisory Responsibilities   This role has no supervisory responsibilities.   Work Environment This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, cameras, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. This position will require travel both on an airplane and long-distance drives in a car. This position will also have occasional work in the warehouse, either in our facility or our customers.â While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to fumes or airborne particles, moving mechanical parts, and vibration. The noise level in the work environment and job sites can be loud.   Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.   The employee is frequently required to sit and stand for prolonged periods of time, regularly required to talk, or hear, walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   Position Type/Expected Hours of Work Full time, between M-F, 9:00am-6:00pm.   Travel 10-20%. Occasional travel outside the local area and overnight. Some travel is international.   Work Authorization Must be able to provide documentation that shows authorization to legally work in the U.S.   AAP/EEO Statement Plus One Robotics provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Agency Note: We are accepting 1099 & W-2 only.     Contract / Contract to hire     This role is local to Dallas/Ft Worth and has a Hybrid WFH vs Office option.        QA Manual Tester        Youâll be joining a multidisciplinary team of product managers, marketers, designers, and engineers who research and innovate on the latest technology to create awesome digital products that millions of people will experience every day.        You will be responsible for testing the systems that improve customer experience, enable innovative user experiences, and increase store revenue. From testing an experimental machine learning prototype to a system with a production-ready backend, manual testers take many hats to see projects to completion. The position is located in Irving, TX (part of the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex). This job requires the candidate to be onsite for most of the days due to the nature of work and the mix of hardware/software testing on Point-of-Sale (POS) systems or actual hardware with Sensors or Machine Learning tools like Computer Vision.     Requirements:           Key Responsibilities :            Demonstrate strong analytical, organizational, problem-solving, and written communication skills.      Detail-oriented, self-motivated individual, deliverable focused, possesses an active, 'hands-on' style - who can work closely with teams of Product Owners, Developers, and Business Users.      Proficient in new feature testing, regression testing, and smoke testing in retail applications. Self Financial is a venture-backed, high-growth FinTech company with a mission to increase economic inclusion and financial resilience by empowering people to build credit and build savings. We're looking for people who share our passion and are driven to tackle challenges, find solutions and make the financial space better for the communities we serve. Our team is passionate about challenging the status quo of the credit industry by providing people accessible tools to take control of their credit. Executing on our mission requires deep collaboration across our teams to ensure our products reach the people who can benefit from them the most, particularly the 100 million+ Americans who have no or low credit.   As an Engineering Manager on our Platform Engineering Teams you will be working at the very core of how we improve our credit-building products and services. You'll be charged with ensuring that our amazing products and team members have the tooling, data, and integrations necessary to reach our goal. The incredible project domains you will work on:  We are looking for a leader who drives impactful solutions at a massive scale for the following Platform Engineering Teams.      Data Engineering:  Ensure that data remains a strategic asset for Self Financial by placing timely, quality managed, and purpose built data into the hands of our team members. Our team supports internal Analytics, Machine Learning, and organizations.    Credit Reporting:  Work in the heart and soul of our mission! Enable timely, accurate credit reporting to all major credit reporting agencies.     Teams that make a difference; individuals that matter:  At Self Financial, we love to put challenges into the hands of talented individuals to solve. Our teams are composed of skilled software engineers who participate in all areas of our creation process including systems design, solution architecture, planning and execution. At Self, we welcome and celebrate leaders who show initiative and creativity. You will carry influence. Our leaders are asked to organize plans that drive outcomes and are challenged to make a direct impact on our mission. About the Job   As an Engineering Manager, you will drive strategic project initiatives to completion while building and mentoring engineering talent. You will work closely with other engineering, product, and client services teams to deliver value-driving solutions. Your team will be fast-paced. As a leader, you will focus on cultivating a team-culture that can operate with a healthy sense of urgency while maturing our engineering architectures and processes.   Who you are:       You are a highly motivated and self-starting professional    You are passionate about people and want to mentor a team of talented software engineers    You want to help grow and mature our software engineering culture and brand    You prefer a fast-paced and environments and shaping rapidly growing organizations    You are passionate about delivering value and care deeply about quality and experience    You like the idea of helping people start (or restart) their financial journey     What you'll be doing:       Leading a team of software engineers to enhance Self's portfolio of credit-building products    Collaborating with Product, Architecture and Infrastructure teams to build a team roadmap    Recruiting and building a diverse engineering team    Driving growth and maturity into your team's processes and procedures    Fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment and work culture     What you'll have:       2+ years in an management or leadership role    5+ years as part of a software engineering experience    Excellent written and verbal communication skills    Experience with agile engineering methodologies    Bachelor degree or equivalent experience     * Benefits and Perks: * We have the compensation and benefits you expect. But, there's one thing that Self Financial can offer that many startups cannot: we can positively change the world, while making a profit. We are a team of Builders, empowering our customers to build their dreams. We have a Do the Right Thing ethos in all that we do, and we hope you value that approach, too. Our perks include:       Stock options    Quarterly performance-based bonuses    Generous employer-paid health, vision and dental insurance coverage    Flexible vacation policy    Educational assistance    Free gym membership    Free at-home workout through Sworkit    Casual dress code    Team building events and activities    Remote work arrangements/ flexible work schedule    Paid parental leave     Self Financial requires all employees hired to successfully pass a background check. Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If youâre interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join eBay â a company you can be proud to be with. Summary : Our eBay Customer Service Technology team is looking for a Service Insights Product Manager to support the implementation of analytical tools focused on improving the way eBay serves its customers. This Product Manager will define our speech and text analytics technology framework, to mine key information within the customer journey, including self-service, assisted service and post-interaction events. They will implement the technology processes, operations, and solutions to uncover opportunities for containment, automation, policy, product, training, and tools improvements across the enterprise. The Service Insights Product Manager will build the ecosystem to collect and understand the data regarding how customers seek help so that we can continue to improve it. This Product Manager will drive strategic discussions, assess business priorities and goals, and guide our Service Delivery Analytics capabilities. They will leverage deep product domain knowledge with analytics to define our products to drive the ability to gather service insights. Through effective communication and global partnership, they will improve our ability to assess end-to-end customer service experiences leading to delightful customer experiences and positive business impact. They will work with our product and engineering teams to keep up to date on our current and upcoming capabilities to be able to recommend high-level solutions to drive our strategy. With minimal guidance, they will manage Analytics strategy and lead Sprint planning, Sprint Backlogs, and sprint execution. Key Responsibilities: Product Definition and Domain Knowledge Pushes for analytics solutions that test the boundaries of industry trends and anticipate customer needs. Defines requirements with high quality and clarity. Ensures the front-end product design is successful. Evaluates global impact by creating hypotheses, carrying out tests and analyzing results. Recognizes patterns in complex datasets and develops practical models. Leads data analysis for Service Insights. Leads implementation detail with deep expertise in speech and text analytics. Identifies corner cases astutely. Have good understanding of industry product and domain implementations and competitive best practices. Steers technical designs towards eBay architectural patterns and high reliability. Understands and manages risks and dependencies. Sets requirements of high-quality products with upfront risk assessment and mitigation strategies, in partnership with Engineering. Encourages others to take personal ownership of live-site production quality, actively participating in problem resolution. Business Impact and Global Partnership Develops a global service insights strategy with minimal guidance and with the support and trust of the Engineering partners. Plans product launches considering the overall analytics product roadmap, GCX interdependencies, anticipated customer reaction, etc. Drives closure of complex cross-team issues in writing. Practices sound judgment in deciding when and how to communicate key messages to partners and executives. Persuades leadership with verbal arguments. Thinks and responds to questions in real-time, varying the approach based on audience needs and reactions. Able to present to Director-level management and support for initiative discussions; hold brownbags and evangelism of products internally and externally; communicate and present materials custom to audience of business and technical. Represents the company to external partners. Leverages's understanding of non-product partners roles to challenge the team. Anticipates and represents product triad's needs. Able to lead and build global partners relationships w/o supervision. Customer Centricity Helps other PMs and business partners understand data sources and tools leading to customer insights. Identifies unmet needs not explicitly requested by customers. Forms a comprehensive and global understanding of the end-to-end customer experience based on a synthesis of insights from multiple sources. Proposes/evaluates product changes in other domains based on a complete understanding of the end-to-end customer experience including competitor analysis. Takes responsibility to ensure resolution of customer problems in other domains. Serves the point leader for Service Insights. High level product vision and understanding details of customer needs driven by insights gathered. Develops effective customer feedback loops. Planning and Project Management Works with product development and quality engineering team leads to consistently manage multiple products to planned milestones with high quality. Effectively plans resourcing based on priorities and constraints. Actively tracks key milestones across multiple programs and maintains accountability for cross-functional team. Proactively charts resource planning for the product roadmap. Creates and manages a complex domain roadmap. Identifies ways that their product can help other teams with their goals. Define domain budget and capacity planning in collaboration with Engineering. Prioritize portfolio of product requirements; monitor progress of portfolio and identify risks/challenges; advise mitigation plans; prioritize product roadmap execution and sequencing of feature development; able to be the Product Owner for the entire product domain portfolio of offerings and services Define dependency requirements and attain alignment of dependency commitments. Job Requirements & Qualifications: 7+ years of Experience as a Product Manager in Customer Service Technology including Self & Guided Service, Contact Channels, Teammate tools & workforce optimization, critical metrics, Data & Analytics Experience leading major digital or service technology transformations involving speech and text analytics Proven Product/technology leader with experience in speech and text analytics, preferably for a complex global customer service organization with a large user/customer base Experience with implementing and configuring products such as Call Miner, Observe.AI, Clarabridge and NICE to uncover concrete insights Experience with predictive modeling, machine learning or text mining Ability to analyze data sources and associate with potential improvements to customers Ability to convey customer and teammate needs through effective storytelling and presentations Speaks and writes with clarity, brevity, and purpose; explains area of expertise clearly and confidently to others; influences and engages with authority and confidence Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced quick changing environment Discernment and experience driving non-linear business outcome through technology solution and implementation at scale Always learning; approaches each interaction with open mind; great listener and hands-on Self-aware and strategic problem solver Proficient at collaboration and building trusted relationships with cross functional teams Desire to continually study new technologies and functionality, as well as be involved in projects that push the capabilities of existing technologies and innovate Critical Thinking & Problem-Solving skills Hands on Data & Analytics experience to help define and measure KPIs Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether youâre single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important. Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. job_title: Senior Business Analyst, NAMR People Team
job_Description: WHAT YOU'LL DO     As a member of the People Business Analytics and Enablement Cadre, you will be at the heart of North Americaâs (NAMR) People Analytics team, acting as a translator and enabler between our team and our clients (NAMR People Leadership and Teams). You will be responsible for supporting the success and adoption of transformational analytics solutions and for utilizing tools like Alteryx and Tableau to help automate and transform People Team reporting.    Your work will directly impact BCGâs high visibility people initiatives, advancing key business priorities for North America. This role has built-in variety and requires toggling across a range of efforts. You will jump in across a wide variety of projects or efforts â sometimes as a designer or as an analyst, and often as the âdoerâ to get efforts underway, pilot or prove a concept, or run a PMO.    Examples of common activities include:         Meeting regularly with People Team members to understand their business priorities and needs      Framing business priorities and needs as actionable analytics questions      Translating analytical questions into hypotheses      Conducting ad-hoc quantitative and qualitative analyses for Senior Leadership      Automating and improving a set of key operational reports using Alteryx, Tableau, and Excel      Supporting large-scale analytics product development, including needs & hypothesis refinement, Agile product development, communication, change management, implementation, and product ownership      Developing compelling slides/decks to communicate and engage, including with Senior Leadership        With the formation of a new team at BCG this is an excellent opportunity for someone with strong core analytical skills to help shape how data reporting is done at BCG. The responsibilities of the role will evolve over time as BCGâs data requirements grow and evolve.     YOU'RE GOOD AT         You excel at problem solving. Youâre equally comfortable with back-of-the-envelope estimates and detailed quant analysis. You can think conceptually and tease out first and second-order impacts and their outcomes      You are highly organized and able to plan project timelines, work backward from deadlines, identify milestones and owners, and execute a project plan. Youâre adept at using digital tools for project work and collaboration.      You can juggle multiple competing priorities, including prioritizing your own work activities and seeking input where required      Youâre exceedingly practical â taking a âget stuff doneâ approach to work. Youâre comfortable in both âdesign modeâ and âexecution mode,â â e.g., update the project tracker, draft the email comms, create the meeting deck and agenda, and conduct follow-ups to ensure agreed actions are completed      Youâre an excellent slide writer and are quick to high-quality output, both for data heavy and qualitative slides. You tend to âthink in slides,â but are a strong writer more broadly, tailoring communications to the audience.      You build strong, trusting relationships. Youâre empathetic, consider stakeholderâs perspectives, and can team effectively across functions and levels.      Youâre comfortable brainstorming and working jointly as a team, but you can also own your work and drive activities independently. You seek feedback and development and take ownership for mistakes. Youâre flexible, adaptable, and eager to learn new skills and content.        YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)     In addition to the skills/strengths identified above, the Business Analyst must have:         An undergraduate degree      2-5 years of professional experience working in an analytical role preferred      Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, a working knowledge of Tableau and Alteryx      Demonstrated project management skills such as the ability to prioritize work, handle multiple workflows at the same time, and communicate progress to team leaders and stakeholders      Comfort with presenting data to Senior Leadership and strong communication skills        YOU'LL WORK WITH     You will work on the Business Analytics & Enablement Cadre within the NAMR People Analytics Team, which also includes a Data Science Cadre. Cadres will combine deep industry expertise with innovative skillsets in consulting, business analytics, computer science, artificial intelligence, statistics, and machine learning. We will drive transformational impact to the North America People Team by framing business challenges, building a single source of truth, distilling the highest impact analytics opportunities, designing innovative analyses and algorithms, training colleagues on new solutions, and delivering impact by ensuring our work is valuable, user-oriented, equitable, scalable, and maintainable.    You will also work closely with the North America People Team members, data and analytics owners from other functions areas (e.g. Finance), and analytics colleagues in other regions. You will have significant exposure to and help drive impact on behalf of the North America Leadership Team (NALT).     ADDITIONAL INFORMATION     Candidates should be aware that BCG currently maintains a policy requiring all US & Canada based employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. BCG is an equal opportunity employer and will provide a reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated for medical or religious reasons where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under applicable federal, state, provincial and local law.

Job Title    Research Engineer III          Agency    Texas A&M Engineering          Department    Electrical Engineering          Proposed Minimum Salary    Commensurate          Job Location    College Station, Texas          Job Type    Staff          Job Description          Who We Are: The advent of advanced instrumentation, detailed environmental data, and precision treatment capabilities in agriculture, provides new and compelling opportunities to apply Data Science to Agricultural Engineering. Texas A&Mâs Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering, the Department of Visualization, AgriLife Research, AgriLife Extension, and the Texas A&M Institute of Data Science (TAMIDS) collaborate in a cross-disciplinary research program that integrates across foundations and practice by (i) using machine learning techniques to model the influence of plant genetics, the environment, and treatment factors on plant growth; (ii) developing algorithms that adaptively optimize treatment over the growing season to meet goals for yield and cost; and (iii) embodying these algorithms in decision support systems that can deliver practical recommendations for crop treatment based on available knowledge.          What We Want: We seek a Research Engineer III who can integrate vertically across machine learning and AI, high performance computing, and data management, to design and produce prototype expert systems which also incorporate interfaces to support user queries and visualization. The position should appeal to someone with a broad set of systems, computing, and Data Science skills who enjoys harnessing state-of-the-art analytic methods to have practical impact in agricultural practice. The initial focus of work concerns development of efficient schedules for crop irrigation, specifically to develop an Unmanned Aerial System (UAS)-based crop monitoring system that models crop water use for irrigation scheduling and increased water use efficiency, based on UAS-derived phenotypic data and infield weather data.             Responsibilities:           Develop and apply advanced data analytics and machine learning methods in agricultural and related domains. Develop models of spatial-temporal dependence of crop growth on treatments and environmental factors. Use tools and libraries for big data analytics including processing of imaging from UAS and geospatial data. Develop APIs for data retrieval and analytics in HPC and cloud-based computing Infrastructure. Develop web-based interfaces for control, query, and analytics reporting. Mentor and support student participation.      Integrate data analytics, computational, and reporting functions in expert information systems. Work with interdisciplinary project team to specify system function and overall design. Develop and implement detailed plan and timeline for system development, including milestones for testing and evaluation of system modules.      Write research articles and project reports. Document system design, functions and usage and develop training for users.      Collaborate on preparation of proposals for further funding.      Perform other duties as assigned.              Required Education:          Bachelorâs degree in Engineering, Science or related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.             Preferred Education:          Appropriate PhD degree             Required Experience:          Four years of related experience             Preferred Experience:           Experience with applications of machine learning and AI in the built or natural environment, with experience related to agriculture a plus      Experience working with data and systems throughout the data cycle: acquisition, storage and management, computation and analytics, query and reporting functions, interfaces and presentation      Experience developing software and systems for large-scale data analytics in science, engineering, or business              Preferred special knowledge, skills and abilities:           Proficiency with common programming languages such as C, C++ and Python,      Knowledge of common Data Science libraries in Python      Knowledge of AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras      Knowledge of GIS and geospatial data systems      Knowledge of computer vision and image processing      Knowledge of data management and databases      Knowledge of high-performance computational and cloud-based systems, tools and architectures      Knowledge of methods for real-world data wrangling and cleaning      Familiarity with design of web-based dashboards and user-interfaces      Ability to cultivate and maintain professional working relationships with people of diverse backgrounds              All positions are security-sensitive. Applicants are subject to a criminal history investigation, and employment is contingent upon the institutionâs verification of credentials and/or other information required by the institutionâs procedures, including the completion of the criminal history check.             Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Veterans/Disability Employer committed to diversity.

job_title: Riser & Marine Engineering â Data Analytics
job_Description: Kongsberg Maritime is at the forefront of technology and innovation within the Maritime, renewable energy and Oil & Gas sector with systems on more than 30,000 vessels and more than 7,000 employees in 120 offices in 34 countries around the world. We have created an integrated portfolio of systems and services for businesses, partners and nations operating from the depths of the sea; to outer space; to the digital frontier.     The Kongsberg Maritime - Advanced Marine Operations - business unit in the Integrated Solutions division is experiencing growing demand for our services and solutions worldwide and are now inviting candidates to apply for employment at our west Houston office.     We are seeking candidates with interest and engineering domain experience within riser and umbilical engineering specifically and generally within energy including renewables, upstream oil & gas and maritime industry preferably combined with data analytics and software development competence.     What's in it for you:     You will be working together with highly skilled colleagues with strong domain knowledge within Floater and Riser/Umbilical/Power cable design and analysis, Dynamic Positioning, Marine Automation & Control System, Sensor Technology, Marine Operations, and all of the necessary infrastructure, tools and data to deliver value to our customers. This includes:         Working with dynamic riser, umbilical and power cable analysis for production and drilling units      Working with offshore wind related projects (design, installation and operation)      Working with hydrodynamic vessel analysis including Kongsberg Dynamic Positioning controllers and control systems      Combine the above to develop statistical and machine learning models for data analysis and operational support      Build and implement algorithms, applications and dashboards to support KMâs product portfolio and customer projects transforming data into actionable items and return value      Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers      Keep up-to-date with latest technology trends in digital technology including machine learning and A.I.      Working with advanced vessel, riser and wellhead monitoring systems as well as data acquisition, analysis and presentation        What do we expect:         Masters/PhD in engineering (Structural/ Mechanical/ Marine/ Naval Architect/ Engineering Mechanics) and/or Applied Math, Physics, Computer Science      0-5 years of relevant experience      Experience with standard riser analysis tools like Flexcom, Orcaflex, Riflex or equivalent software tools is preferred      Familiarity with standard production riser systems including SCRs, top tension risers and flexible risers etc. is preferred      Familiarity with subsea umbilicals and power cables is preferred      Familiarity with drilling riser systems and analysis is preferred      Programming experience in one or more of the following: Python, Matlab, C# or C++      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to interpret high-level business objectives into a strategy      Self-initiated learner, positive attitude, flexible and willing to adapt to changing situations        What do we offer:         Opportunity to work with products leading the digitalization efforts in energy, upstream oil & gas and maritime industry      Challenging work in an international technology leading and innovative work environment      Opportunity to work in a highly competent and client-driven business      A high degree of personal autonomy within agreed areas of responsibility      Competitive remuneration package and benefits      Fully Subsidized dental and vision coverage      Highly subsidized health & welfare benefits with an option of a zero-dollar high deductible plan which includes an employer contribution towards your health savings account      Up to 5% employer match program      Flexibility with Paid Time Off      An exciting journey in a safe and collaborative culture        Throughout the pandemic, weâve made it a top priority to keep our employees safe from COVID-19. Consistent with its duty to provide and maintain a workplace that is free of recognized hazards, Kongsberg Maritime has adopted a policy to safeguard the health and well-being of employees and their fami lies, our customers and visitors, others who spend time in our facilities, customer installations, and the community from the risks associated with COVID-19. job_title: Digital Assurance & Transpar. Tech & Data Associate - Summer/Fall 2022
job_Description: A career in our Analytics Data Assurance practice, within Risk Assurance Compliance and Analytics services, will provide you with the opportunity to assist clients in developing analytics and technology solutions that help them detect, monitor, and predict risk. Using advanced technology, weâre able to focus on establishing the right controls, processes and structures for our clients to ensure that decisions are based on accurate information and assure that information provided to third parties is accurate, complete, and can be trusted. Our team helps business leaders navigate evolving risks by staying ahead of uncertainty by developing smart infrastructure and harnessing data through analytics. As a part of the team, youâll help us develop cost effective technology solutions that focus on delivering relevant, actionable intelligence that executives need to understand operations and manage critical risks.    To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.        As an Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:            Invite and give in the moment feedback in a constructive manner.      Share and collaborate effectively with others.      Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise.      Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.      Follow risk management and compliance procedures.      Keep up-to-date with developments in area of specialism.      Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in the materials I produce.      Build and maintain an internal and external network.      Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms.      Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.           An Associate in PwC's Tech and Data team within our Digital Assurance and Transparency practice will:         Participate in all phases of a financial statement audit and audit of internal controls;      Participate in a range of projects; consistently demonstrating creative thinking and initiative;      Demonstrate teamwork dynamics through working as a team member;      Identify and address client needs; and,      Demonstrate flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks while exercising professional skepticism. Demonstrates some abilities and/or a proven record of success in exhibiting general awareness about global issues to identify and address client needs, including in the following areas:         Utilizing critical thinking that breaks down complex problems, understands root causes, and proposes viable solutions while maintaining quality;      Working in collaborative and team based environment, delivering with diverse global client, PwC and third-party teams;      Demonstrating ability to learn accounting principles and business processes;      Demonstrating ability to learn how to evaluate, cleanse, design, and implement data models using data mining techniques;      Understanding business intelligence and relational database concepts, as well as big data objectives, concepts, and technologies such as Hadoop;      Demonstrating ability to identify and incorporate tools and techniques using technology applications (e.g. Microsoft SQL Server, ACL, Access/Excel, Visual Basic, R, Python, SAS, Stata, Alteryx) and build reporting capabilities through data visualization (e.g. Tableau, Spotfire, Qlikview, Einstein Analytics);      Demonstrating knowledge of descriptive analytics, predictive analytics, machine learning principles, AI, robotic process automation (RPA), project management, software and solution implementation methodologies; and,      Understanding various facets of business and/or IT processes, concepts of enterprise risk, internal controls, ERPs and CRMs, cloud solutions, corporate compliance and regulatory mandates, portfolio, program, and agile team management, technical aspects of information systems, financial reporting concepts, and systems development methodology. Pandion is a technology-first transportation provider. Tailor-made for e-commerce, Pandion delivers a high performing one-day and two-day delivery experience for all. We are a startup, and want people who are interested in moving fast, breaking things, and building something amazing from scratch.  We are an agile team with continuous integration and you will be responsible for designing and building many of the new components. Logistics provides many of the toughest problems to solve in industry. The problem space spans many challenges on which the customer experience is dependent, including forecasting demand, network route pathfinding, data analysis, and building, scaling, and improving tools. Pandion continuously seeks to focus on serving the needs of e-commerce shippers and their customers.  If you are obsessed with customers and excited to develop new technologies and high-performing operations, come build the future with us! About the Role  You will be responsible for supporting our product, engineering, leadership and operations teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. We are looking for someone adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization. One must have strong experience with a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. Driving business results with data-based insights while collaborating with a wide range of stakeholders is crucial. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and using them to deliver an excellent, and continue improve, the customer experience.   Roles and Responsibilities   Partner with internal stakeholders (Strategy, Ops etc) to develop data pipelines of regularly needed views of data for adhoc reporting and analysis. Collaborate closely with internal users to translate core business logic into our datasets and metrics.  Champion the growth of analytics/BI maturity curve within Pandion. Provide toolsets and roadmap for growing adhoc analytics workflows into self-serve BI toolsets of the future.  Develop and maintain ETL pipelines in production that provides clean, accurate reliable dataset to internal end-users.  Maintain insights and metrics pipelines that are robust to changes in core datasets including customer pipelines. Design reporting and analytics solutions. For example provide support for metrics needed for weekly business review.  Drive and facilitate design discussion for the data models, tables and ETLs for analytics. Monitor and maintain uptime of the system critical pipelines.   Skills and Experience   Demonstrate ability to gain in-depth understanding of the business, strong analytical and communication skills to translate high level asks into technical requirements and roadmaps.  Demonstrated ability to communicate data results, insights, and uncertainties to business and non-technical stakeholders  Data visualization skills to present complex metrics and analysis with impactful data visuals.  SQL, excel, tableau (or looker), python.  Nice-to-have: Experience with Airflow or other orchestration tools. Open source visualization tools to tell intuitive data stories   Pandion offers an excellent benefits package including Medical Insurance, Dental, and Vision insurance. Employees are eligible for 401(k) contribution match. Employees are eligible for equity options to purchase stock in the company.  Pandion is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive working environment. We do not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

With our growing customer base and our expansion into new markets and use cases, we have more to build than ever at Affinity as we execute on our vision to put relationship intelligence at every professional's fingertips.  At the foundation of the Affinity platform, there is a vast and comprehensive data set about people, companies and relationships. As a  Search Engineer , you'll have the opportunity to unlock the power of this data through search, enabling our customers to answer critical questions and uncover valuable insights that will drive their success.  As an engineer on the team, you will define, design and implement key initiatives in building the new Search features that, build a robust, scalable model development, training, validation and implementation. To be successful, you'll be partnering with product, user experience, customer success and other engineering teams to identify, define and build elegant solutions.  What you'll be doing:   Work as part of our software engineering team to improve the search experience using large data sets.  Participate in product areas that are critical to the success of our customers and our business.  Work in boosting answer quality by meeting the challenges such as lexical gap, semantic text understanding, and data sparsity.  Craft new ranking features and optimizing existing ones to enhance relevance metrics.  Develop an algorithm framework to support diversified ranking features.  Develop metrics to evaluate ranking performance.  Collaborate with world-class engineering, product, and design teams-you'll have the opportunity to learn from a wide variety of experiences and, of course, to share your own.  Grow your expertise and fluency with the core pieces of technology that serve as the foundation for the Affinity product.   Qualifications  Required:   Delivering high-quality and robust products to customers while also championing technical excellence.  2+ years of hands-on experience in one or more of the following areas: Information Retrieval, NLP and machine learning.  Work with a variety of web APIs and developed search services using at least one modern language such as Java, C++ and high-level scripting languages like Python or Perl.  Effective communications skills, as well as the ability to work efficiently across internal and external organizations and aptitude for motivating and inspiring a team.   Nice to have:   Advanced Degree in Computer Science or related fields.  Computer Science fundamentals in data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis.  Interest in Search, Machine Learning, and Natural Language Processing.  Experience in Search, A/B experimentation, Distributed Computing, Data Analysis, Information Retrieval.  Experience presenting complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.  Track record of project delivery for cross-functional projects.  Experience with Elasticsearch.  3+ years of experience as a software engineer, including familiarity with the different pieces of technology involved in building modern web applications, search engines.   What you'll enjoy at Affinity   We live our values as playmakers who are obsessed with learning, care personally about our colleagues and clients, are radically open-minded, and take pride in everything we do.  We pay your medical, dental, and vision insurance with comprehensive PPO and HMO plans. And provide flexible personal & sick days. We want our team to be happy and healthy :)  We offer a 401k plan to help you plan for retirement.  We provide an annual budget for you to spend on education and offer a comprehensive L&D program â after all, one of our core values is that we're #obsessedwithlearning!  We support our employee's overall health and well-being and reimburse monthly for things such as; Transportation, Home Internet, Meals, and Wellness memberships/equipment.  Virtual team building and socials. Keeping people connected is essential.  About Affinity  We are passionate about helping dealmakers in the world's biggest relationship-driven industries to find, manage, and close the most important deals. Our Relationship Intelligence platform uses the data exhaust of trillions of interactions between Investment Bankers, Venture Capitalists, Consultants, and other strategic dealmakers with their networks to deliver automated relationship insights that drive over 450,000 deals every month. We have raised over $120M and are backed by some of Silicon Valley's best firms. With over 1700 customers in 70 countries on our platform, a 4.8 Star Glassdoor rating and being ranked in the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies, we need more great people to help us scale even more.  The more diverse our team is, the more we'll be able to learn from each other, and the better our company and our product will be. Whatever your gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, veteran status, favorite Spotify playlist, or social, cultural, and economic background, we can't wait to welcome you to Affinity!

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Graph Sampler - RAPIDS
job_Description: NVIDIA is looking for a self-motivated software engineer with strong Graph and Graph Neural Network (GNN) application and development experience to join NVIDIA's RAPIDS cuGraph team. RAPIDS is the open-source suite of libraries for GPU-accelerated data science, with cuGraph being the library for accelerated large scale graph analysis. RAPIDS cuGraph is growing support for GNN training through better support for substantial graph and faster sampling. As graph sizes grow, sampling can consume a significant portion of the GNN training time. We are looking for an engineer to help us both expand the list of sampling techniques and improve performance across all size graphs. RAPIDS supports customers and partners ranging from individual data scientists to the world's largest supercomputers and Fortune 500 companies. As a member of RAPIDS cuGraph team, you will help develop new algorithms, heuristics, and techniques for solving complex graph problems faster. Join our diverse team to support NVIDIA's vision by developing Python code for addressing the toughest problems in graph analysis and graph neural networks.        What you will be doing:         Developing groundbreaking graph sampling approaches that scales to trillions of edges.      Interact with the GNN community on new graph sampling approaches.      Performance tuning, optimization, and benchmarking of large-scale parallel graph algorithms on various GPU architectures.      Providing technical leadership and mentorship to engineers working with you.      Working closely with product management and other internal and external partners to understand feature, accuracy, and performance requirements and contribute to the technical roadmaps of the library.      Finding opportunities to improve the code base and reduce code maintenance overhead through re-architecting.      These issues are by nature complex and will require you to find and explain sophisticated solutions, exercise leadership, and coordinate with multiple teams to achieve your objectives.           What we need to see:         PhD or Masterâs degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, or related science or engineering field of study (or equivalent experience)      4+ years of experience.      Proven experience developing, debugging, and optimizing high-performance parallel applications.      Excellent programming and software design skills with experience in C/C++ and CUDA preferred.      Deep understanding of fundamental graph analysis techniques as applied to solving customer problems.      Strong collaboration, communication, and documentation habits.           Ways to stand out from the crowd:         Functional style programming (STL algorithms, Thrust) including lambda functions.      Solid understanding of system architecture, CPU/GPU/Memory/Storage, everything related to performance optimization.      Good knowledge of computer hardware architecture.      Experience in the following areas:             C++ 14 and 17        Python        Generic programming (Template),        Using CUDA and GPU programming,        Developing a graph analysis framework.        Working in an open source and agile software development environment.                NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology worldâs most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!     The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in Colorado. The base salary range for this position in Colorado is $126,000.00 - 173,250.00 USD.    NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave, professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.        Base pay is based on market location and may vary based on factors including experience, skills, education, and other job-related reasons.     NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Starting with airlines, we provide the Cirrus Revenue Operating Systemâ¢ that reshapes how travel and transportations businesses plan their commercial operation. BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field     1+ years of experience with hardware/software integration for embedded systems or hardware development     Experience working in Linux environments     Experience writing scripts using Perl/Python/lua/Bash or another scripting language     Job summary   Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. We have data center locations in the U.S., Europe, Singapore, and Japan, and customers across all industries. We are seeking experienced Hardware Design Engineers to build the next generation of our cloud server infrastructure. Our success depends on our world-class server infrastructure; weâre handling massive scale and rapid integration of emergent technologies.      As a member of the Machine Learning Acceleration team youâll be responsible for the design and optimization of hardware in our data centers. Youâll provide leadership in the application of new technologies to large scale server deployments in a continuous effort to deliver a world-class customer experience. This is a fast-paced, intellectually challenging position, and youâll work with thought leaders in multiple technology areas. Youâll have high standards for yourself and everyone you work with, and youâll be constantly looking for ways to improve your products performance, quality and cost. UNT System Overview                  Welcome to the University of North Texas System, or UNT World as we like to call ourselves. UNT World includes the University of North Texas in Denton, the University of North Texas at Dallas and the University of North Texas Health Science Center in Fort Worth. We are the only university system based exclusively in the robust Dallas-Fort Worth region and we are committed to transforming lives and creating economic opportunity through education. We are growing with the DFW region, enrolling a record 47,000+ students across our system and awarding nearly 12,000 degrees each year.                                                 Posting Title                          Asst Professor/Assoc Professor                                                Department                          UNT-Information Science-133310                                                College/School                          College of Information                                                Job Location                          Denton                                                Full Time/Part Time                          Full-Time                                                Salary Information                                                        Department Summary                          The Department of Information Science, one of three departments in the College of Information, promotes the understanding of, access to and use of data and information through teaching, research and service activities. The department prepares data and information professionals of the highest quality to serve in dynamic roles locally, nationally and globally. Faculty members of the department measure their success by the success of their students and the quality of intellectual contributions to the profession and society.                    The American Library Association has accredited the departmentâs masterâs program continuously since 1965. The Department offers two bachelorâs degrees, post-masterâs certificates, and a doctoral degree in Information Science. Detailed information about the department can be found at https://informationscience.unt.edu/.                    UNT has a highly diverse campus with a wide range of languages spoken in addition to English. Position Summary                                    The Department of Information Science at the University of North Texas (UNT) invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant/Associate Professor position. Position will begin on Fall semester 2022. We are seeking exceptional candidates with interests in a wide range of topics within the theoretical, machine learning, and computational foundations of data science. The candidate will teach, conduct research, and provide service in an academic position with emphasis in Data Science. The candidate must demonstrate a record of research accomplishments and have the ability to design and deliver courses in a variety of formats, including online and hybrid modalities in Data Science. The candidate is expected to teach Data Science undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral level courses and advise students in Data Science research. They are expected to work closely with doctoral students and to serve on dissertation committees. Exceptional candidates at the rank of Associate Professor will be considered. The College of Information and Department of Information Science are committed to creating a learning community that reflects and enacts the values of diversity, equity and inclusion that inform academic excellence. We encourage applicants who may enhance our representational diversity but especially whose research, teaching, and community engagement will contribute to diverse, equitable, and inclusive learning and working environments for our students, staff, and faculty.
