Job Category  Products and Technology       Job Details     Salesforce is embarking on our own Digital Transformation to deliver customer success for our customers and accelerate our growth. Our teamâs mission is to envision, build, and deploy the next generation end-to-end platform for data ingestion, processing, storage, analysis, and activation for personalized marketing and customer engagements at massive scale. Weâre building the AI Decision Factory for Salesforce marketing and we need dedicated product leaders to help us bring this to life.         We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced Product Management Director for our AdTech and Analytics Platforms to productize the paid media technology and digital measurement platform development efforts for Salesforce Marketing. In this role, you will work with Engineering and Marketing collaborators to orchestrate and improve Salesforceâs global digital Advertising technologies and customer intent signals in close collaboration with our teams and strategic partners.         As part of Data Product Management within the Marketing Decision Science team,  you will use your knowledge of the ad tech industry to create strategic roadmaps, drive agile development cycles with engineering, build global adoption strategies for our products with all of our collaborators, and drive innovation we can use to deliver better business outcomes for Salesforce.  Your goal is to build a next generation Ads platform from foundational tag capture work all the way to machine learning models to deliver statistically significant ROI lift.         The Marketing Decision Science group serves as an innovation lab for Salesforce products and customer zero for the next generation of the Salesforce platform. This role is expected to closely collaborate for our platform product organization, drive cutting edge innovations, and serve as a trusted partner and advisor for the Salesforce product development team for digital marketing applications.         Remote within USA. PST is the preferred timezone.         Responsibilities         Define product vision,  implement landmarks with a team of Engineers and authorities,  align and drive the roadmaps for our internal Ad Tech products and Analytical measurement products (Google Analytics) globally, coordinating  with other PMsâ roadmaps and partnering closely with subject matter authorities in this space.      Lead requirements by demonstrating industry vendors, proposing how to improve analysis at scale, building hypothesis testing through experimentation at the core of everything we do, and accelerating our understanding of our Ad ecosystem.      Identify and mitigate our product risks and various dependencies with Legal and Security.      Bring a focus on productivity to amplify our ad strategies while  tracking and reporting on the execution of product landmarks & deliverables relative to critical metric targets.      Increase the service capabilities and partner with the various Marketing teams to deliver value that exceeds expectation with visibility all the way to our CMO.      Dive deep to learn our current Ad Tech needs, technical capabilities, and data available by partnering with engineering, data authorities, and marketers to invent new capabilities, challenge existing ones and complete your initiatives.      Enhance efficiency and flexibility in a constantly evolving environment where the processes are fluid and data trust is our #1 value.        Minimum Qualifications         10+ years of experience with end-to-end product delivery  as a product manager or related position, where you've built and launched digital products to end users with highly cross-functional teams.      Display strong leadership, organizational and execution skills.      5+ years hands-on experience with major Ad tech platforms, Digital Analytics Platforms, and understanding of paid media delivery strategy for Fortune 100 brands.      Analytical and positive mentality.      Skilled in turning complex and nuanced concepts into simple practical tasks.      Experience owning roadmap strategy and definition.      Experience owning feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product.      Bachelor's Degree.        Preferred Qualifications         MBA or Technical Master Degree.      Ability to self-direct and work independently, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed commitments/objectives and take ownership of complex problems. At Pattern Bioscience, weâre tackling antibiotic resistance, one of the biggest public health challenges of our time. We use AI and single-cell analysis to quickly recognize the bacteria causing an infection and to predict which drugs will cure the infection.                  To fulfill our mission and build world-changing technology, weâve put together a diverse, multi-disciplinary top-notch team, a culture of innovation, learning, adaptability, and excellence and environment where people love coming to work.                  We are looking for a teammate, a problem solver, someone who is persistent, passionate, and loves to see projects to completion. As the Software Test Engineer, you will join our Instrument team and bring your deep experience in software testing to lead efforts in making sure we have a complete and robust suite of tests to verify and validate the software applications on our diagnostic instrument.                      This position offers you the opportunity to      join a mission-driven, entrepreneurial company that values openness and collaboration, where you can have ownership and make an impact on lifesaving technology, innovation, and your fellow teammates.                   The Role             You will work with Firmware/Software Developers to design, create, enhance, and maintain detailed test cases and conduct testing. You will also work with the Software Quality Engineer to ensure that our testing output (automated and manual) meets regulatory requirements.                    How You Will Contribute             Participate in requirements and design review meetings to create comprehensive test strategies/plans.  Report, track and escalate anomalies discovered during testing and ensure closure on issues.  Design, create, enhance and maintain detailed test cases and conduct testing.  Automate testing to improve the timeliness and accuracy of our software life cycle.  Work with cross functional team to deliver verification and validation deliverables that meet regulatory requirements.                          Experience Requirements             Enjoy working in a multidisciplinary environment that includes engineers, software developers and scientists  Working knowledge of C++ or Python testing automation  Building a test automation framework  Have 3+ years of experience testing the following (at least 2):  Embedded Systems  Image Processing Services  Graphical User Interface  Web Application (Front and Back End)  Machine Learning Algorithm                          A Plus if You Have Experience With             Testing around cybersecurity requirements  Working in a regulated environment  Regulatory and compliance frameworks such as IEC 62304, 21 CFR Part 11, 21 CFR Part 820, ISO 13485                          How to Prepare for Your Interview             Engage us in a discussion of your track record of creative problem solving  Tell us why you want to work in an environment like the one at Pattern  Question us on how aspects of our technology work                          Join us!              We're excited for what you can bring to our team. Here are a few things we provide to make sure you have a great experience. Learn more about our team by visiting our website.                       Benefits              Health insurance      401k Matching      Paid Time Off      The opportunity to make a global impact                       We value diversity on our teams. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Financial Services Organization: Service Delivery Center - Analyst, CRM - TX
job_Description: At EY, youâll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And weâre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Ernst & Young LLP (EY) is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (FSO) dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. This practice also has several Service Delivery Centers that are made up of high-performing US-based resources who work closely with our experienced client-serving professionals to deliver project-based work and managed services to our US-based financial services clients. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team! As a member of the Salesforce Solutions Delivery Team you will collaborate on challenging projects that enable you to have a real economic impact for our clients and communities â and your career. Our integrated, issues-based approach to service delivery means your work will span all types of clients dealing with complex issues across a wide range of industries. As part of this team, youâll join talented individuals who have deep industry, product and client knowledge. We focus on two distinct areas: We help clients develop strategies to drive transformational change. We provide strategy through execution. We help define business strategy for our clients and bring those strategies to life, realizing actual value to achieve new levels of business performance. We help clients improve their business processes to drive business outcomes. We help finance functions keep pace with evolving business priorities; sales and marketing teams attract and retain valuable customer relationships; internal audit functions become more relevant to the business; and supply chains deliver lower costs, more revenue and better shareholder value. We help design and implement the technologies that drive business performance. We help our clients make sense of all the existing and emerging technologies available and enable clients to use them to their advantage. The opportunity: As an Analyst, youâll be based in our Service Delivery Center, which is made up of high-performing US-based colleagues who work closely with our experienced advisory professionals. We deliver Salesforce Solutions project-based work and managed services to our clients. Here, youâll work as part of a project team and will be responsible for the design, build/configuration, testing, analysis, delivery and support of Salesforce Solutions. This position is fast-paced and ever-changing, which means youâll need to be a flexible self-starter and be able to manage changing priorities and learning new and rapidly changing technology solutions. During your introductory training weâll help you to develop your Salesforce Solution technical and soft business skills to support your career, so you can learn emerging technology and be empowered to jump right in. Youâre likely to balance your time among different Salesforce solutions and other immersive technologies such as azure, robotics, machine learning and blockchain. Itâs all about interpreting business and technical requirements, enabling leading practices as well as executing delivery activities across the clientâs organization. As part of that, youâll need to be a logical thinker and have an active passion for learning and being challenged. Your key responsibilities: Participate in all delivery phases of Salesforce Solution deployments Develop requirements specifications and design documents Create use cases for business process flows Work on Salesforce customizations such as creating entities, forms, workflows, business rules Work on dashboards and reports Document design workshop deliverables Complete configuration documents Conduct unit tests and analyze results to confirm that developed code meets requirements Support user acceptance testing and defect resolution Develop training and communications materials to drive user adoption Support the Managers and Senior Managers in upward stakeholder management and day-to-day management of the Salesforce Competency within the Service Delivery Center To qualify for the role, you must have: A bachelor's degree in business, computer science, engineering, information systems or related technology majors, or related field preferred At least two years of experience as a member of a technology team participating in one or many of the technology life cycle phases; could include requirements definition, architecture design, conversion and testing An interest in software configuration, development, workflow and process design, analysis and quality assurance Analytical thinking and aptitude to learn and adapt latest technologies and best industry standards and practices Good understanding of basic programming concepts At least two years of experience with implementing technology solutions using Agile and Waterfall methodologies At least two years of experience with analyzing and solving problems of a complex nature and working with business, management and technology concepts Familiarity with Salesforce, other CRM solutions or cloud-based technologies is a plus Experience working in a shared services function and environment a plus Demonstrated project management, teaming, organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills Willingness and ability to travel up to 20% of the time A driverâs license valid in the US What we look for Weâre interested in intellectually curious people with a passion for finding new and innovative ways to make things better. Youâll also need to be a self-starter and quick learner with a strong background in computer science from both theoretical and practical points of view. If youâre ready to be the future of the group and make your mark in a growing business, this role is for you. What we offer We offer a competitive compensation package where youâll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, youâll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. Youâll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Continuous learning: Youâll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: Weâll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: Weâll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: Youâll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The exceptional EY experience. Itâs yours to build. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Posting Title:    Postdoctoral Fellow      -        Hiring Department:    Oden Institute      -        Position Open To:    All Applicants      -        Weekly Scheduled Hours:    40      -        FLSA Status:    Exempt      -        Earliest Start Date:    Immediately      -        Position Duration:    Expected to Continue Until Mar 20, 2023      -        Location:    UT MAIN CAMPUS      -        Job Description:    Collaborate on research in the Oden Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences under the supervision of Dr(s) John-Paul Clarke, Ufuk Topcu and/or Karen Willcox. Will help lead research efforts in a project aiming to establish an algorithmic foundation that will support the development, deployment, and adoption of advanced air mobility systems for autonomous cargo operations at scale. The project is funded by NASA through its University Leadership Initiative. The postdoctoral scholar will collaborate with teams from University of Texas at Austin, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Purdue University and a range of additional partners from academia, industry, and government.      -        Job Details:    General Notes      The Oden Institute is an organized research unit that fosters interdisciplinary programs in computational sciences and engineering, computational medicine, computational geosciences, mathematical modeling, applied mathematics, data science, software engineering, and computational visualization. PhD must have been received within the past three years. The position is funded for a year with possibility of continuation based upon performance review, progress towards research goals, and continuation of funding. The appointment is initially for one year and renewable up to 3 years.      Candidates will need to upload a letter of interest, resume/CV, copies of 2-3 publications written by the candidate and list of three references.        UT Austin offers a competitive benefits package that includes:       100% employer-paid basic medical coverage   Retirement contributions   Paid vacation and sick time   Paid holidays      https://hr.utexas.edu/current/services/my-total-rewards      Responsibilities   Conduct research in areas related to the project.   Supervise graduate and undergraduate research assistants.   Participate in technical conferences,   Support project reporting.   Support the organization of workshops. Excellent leadership, communication, and management skills.   While the priority is on the novelty of the candidateâs past work and potential for professional growth, the following topics are of particular interest: controls, formal methods, optimization, machine learning, engineering risk analysis, and system safety.   Ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary research team.   Solid publication record. Repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation.   Travel as required to project meetings or conferences.      Required Materials   Letter of Interest   Resume/CV   Copies of 2â3 publications written by the candidate   Three references   Arrange at least two (2) confidential reference letters be sent to Kay Brown (kay@oden.utexas.edu)   Proof of Ph.D. in field of engineering or computer science. job_title: IT Data Analytics Advisor (Houston, TX) Job
job_Description: ABOUT HESS CORPORATION    Hess is a leading international independent energy company engaged in the exploration and production of crude oil and natural gas.    We have an industry leading position in the Bakken in North Dakota â a key U.S. shale play. Hess is also one of the largest producers in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico and a key natural gas producer and supplier to Peninsular Malaysia and Thailand. The company is engaged in exploration and appraisal activities offshore Guyana, participating in one of the industryâs largest oil discoveries in the past decade, as well as the Gulf of Mexico, Suriname and Nova Scotia.     Hess aims to attract, retain and energize the best people by investing in their professional development and providing them with challenging and rewarding opportunities for personal growth. We are always looking for talented professionals who share our values and are passionate about making a difference in the world and in their careers. We strive to meet the highest standards of corporate citizenship by protecting the health and safety of our employees, safeguarding the environment and creating a long-lasting, positive impact on the communities where we do business.     For more information about Hess Corporation, please visit our website at Hess.com.        About the Job    As an advisor on the Advanced Analytics and Data Science team at Hess, you will lead design, architecture, and implementation of solutions that drive decision-making, execution and investments for our project initiatives across various areas of the business. The role will be responsible for contributing in an advisory context to a high-performing team and delivering end-to-end solutions to business problems that will pave the path to a data and insights-driven enterprise. Success requires strong leadership skills, first-principles problem-solving, a willingness to roll up your sleeves and a dedication to make the highest impact possible toward solution completion and value optimization. We are looking for someone who is eager to learn, comfortable with challenges outside of their preexisting expertise and comfort zones, that can think on their feet and thrive in a dynamic environment while ensuring the deepest level of business partnership to ensure an impactful solution delivery and continued business relationship growth.        This role will also help evangelize and advance the usage, engagement, and satisfaction of Advanced Analytics and Data Science offerings and will advocate for a customer-focused mindset within the analytics team. This individual will be responsible for design, architecture, and implementation of delivering cutting-edge data science and machine learning products to internal customers, enabling them to make data-driven decisions and optimizing their preexisting processes. This individual will have the ability to shape and elevate the maturity and democratization of data analytics and machine learning capability and adoption across the organization. They will be vital to extending and advancing the integration of machine learning and data science products into the core business model of Hess Oil Co.        Successful applicants for this position must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment .        Responsibilities        Analytics and Data Science                    Serve as a principal data science expert to help drive the organization in the adoption and advancement of analytics and machine learning capabilities. This will be done through development and delivery of data science and analytics solutions and teaching the data science discipline to others.        Evangelize and lead the establishment of the data and analytics function by cultivating the power of data-driven insights into the organization through the development and continued expansion of the âAnalytics Academyâ education program.        Serve as an analytics expert for your stakeholders, helping them break down business problems and make better decisions using analytics.        Make critical recommendations and work closely with the business stakeholders to ensure coordination and successful solution delivery.        Oversee and implement software development, data science, and machine learning skillsets to contribute to the delivery of complex analytics and machine learning solutions.                Strategic Vision & Portfolio Delivery                    Assist in collaboration with leaders across the organization to develop meaningful strategic directions and visions for the core team as well as democratize and scale data and analytics capability across the organization.        Engauge in an agile project delivery rhythm that continuously considers input from key business stakeholders and improves procedures based on learnings from prior iterations.                Leadership                    Play an active role in our teamâs leadership, taking initiative to execute and build upon our mission objectives toward the betterment and proliferation of data analytics and machine learning throughout the organization.        Work in collaboration with our external contract resources in both an advisory/mentor role and partnered collaborator.        Lead by example and assist in developing, implementing, and exemplifying best practices and streamlined processes,        Create and maintain a highly productive, professional, partnership focused, and value-driven culture.        Partner cross-functionally with leadership across the organization including Technology, Assets, and Service Delivery functions to ensure a cohesive vision and delivery of analytics solutions and capabilities.        Leverage differing skillsets and experiences of team members to create a whole greater than the sum of its parts and instill a positive, constructive, and collaborative culture across the team.                Minimum qualifications:         Bachelor's degree or above in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Sciences, Physics or other physical sciences.      7+ years of industry experience in physical sciences, data sciences, machine learning or engineering      2+ years of experience with machine learning, data engineering, and model deployment      Proficient understanding of statistical, machine learning, and data science methodologies used to oversee, validate, and design data science solutions.      Comfortable at influencing without authority and passionate about people and mentorship in technical and scientific domains.      Ability to build clear and concise presentations and communicate effectively at every level of the organization including senior leadership (c-level and up).      Proven track record of building strong partnerships with business stakeholders to understand underlying business problems and translate business needs into technical requirements & solutions even in an ambiguous setting.      Strong ability to lead and implement data engineering, machine learning, and client facing technologies from research and development to product development to deployment and maintenance phases.      Strong technical computing proficiency in compiled or scripted languages (e.g. C/C++, C#, Python, SQL)      Strong conceptual understanding of software development principles and containerized deployment technologies.      Experience building cloud hosted solutions (e.g. Azure, AWS, etc..)           Preferred qualifications:         Master's or Ph.D degree with emphasis on coursework in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Sciences, Physics or other physical sciences.      Experience in scripting with advanced SQL, extracting large sets of data, and design of ETL flows.      Experience with building machine learning models, model performance assessments, and optimization techniques.      Experience working in an agile project management environment.      Experience working with data science programming languages (e.g. Python) and associated packages (e.g. numpy, sklearn, pytorch, etc.).      Experience working with recent and leading-edge deep learning computer vision technologies a plus (e.g. gans, unet, resnet, etc.) a plus.      Experience working with compiled, object-oriented programming languages (c#, java, etc..) a plus.      Experience working with containerized service deployment (docker) and web hosted service frameworks (e.g. asp.net, django, flask, etc.) a plus.      Oil & Gas industry experience or equivalent in petroleum/reservoir/completions/drilling engineering or geosciences a plus.      Familiarity with Geology and Geoscience data, concepts and workflows           Industry         Information Technology      Upstream Oil & Gas           Competencies     The Hess Way of Working refers to competencies considered absolute pre-requisites for success. How you deliver results is as important as what you achieve. Every employee is expected to demonstrate the behaviors within these competencies to be considered an effective performer and, ultimately, earn career growth opportunities.         Builds Trusted Relationships      Develops Talent      Creates Effective Teams      Thinks Strategically      Inspires Innovation      Demonstrates Courage      Drives Continuous Improvement      Makes Quality Decisions      Delivers High Performance           Employment Type     Full-time        Posting Notes: Lisa B Willet | Employee | Information Technology | United States| Texas | Houston | | | | | No | 26013

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys taking ownership and building features at all levels of the stack and requires a mix of analytical horsepower, relentless execution, and well-honed user judgment. You will learn to think holistically about a portfolio of products and the business deeply to set the right long-term direction across teams and partners.        What will I be responsible for in this job?         Define and drive a roadmap to accelerate how prospects and buyers discover, try, buy, and use Change Healthcareâs products using high quality, self-service experiences      Identify, prioritize, and execute on solutions to key problem spaces & opportunities by leveraging your product expertise and analytical insights and working cross-functionally with strategy, product, engineering, design, analytics, and sales teams      Engage and cultivate relationships with product and platform partners to influence shared cross-team directions and manage risks or trade-offs. Comfortable owning goals and metrics      Experience with engaging multiple user/buyer personas across eCommerce/engagement channels      Strong user experience sensibilities and familiarity with platform UI best practices.      Strong use of analytics, user research, and business cases to drive decisions and improve products.      Ability to operate under tight deadlines while maintaining multiple projects.      Experienced in planning work for assigned workstreams.      Experience in iterative product development building consumer-facing experiences, back-end processing, reporting and analytics, and machine learning. job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Data Science Recommendations
job_Description: Who We Are  Wayfair Data Science powers automation & decision support across all Wayfair business units. Our algorithms tackle a varied & broad spectrum of challenges in the Wayfair marketplace; from empowering suppliers to easily add products to our catalog, to enabling our customers to discover and purchase a vast & diverse assortment of home goods.  The Data Science Search & Recommendations team is looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to expand upon our industry-leading recommendations platform and content personalization engine to maximize Customer Lifetime Value using the wealth of data we have about our customers and their preferences. Wayfairâs Recommendations team provides the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover and buy the products they love by serving the right content to every customer on every touchpoint. Our systems leverage Wayfairâs extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations and results in real-time using custom machine learning models. Our mission-critical services are called over a billion times a day. Recommendations are a core competency for Wayfair and a high-priority lever weâre using to drive outsized growth, customer value, and profitability.  In this role, youâll partner with fellow data scientists, engineers, analysts, and product managers to bring our next-generation personalization models to life. Youâll spend one part of your day reading white papers and the other part of your day implementing them. Youâll test and explore state-of-the-art deep learning architectures on terabytes of data. Youââ explore reinforcement learning approaches for generating recommendations for customers across multiple channels. Youâll explore how to evaluate and de-bias recommender systems offline. The models you develop will have tremendous business impact, directly measurable through our online A/B test platform.   What Youâll Do   Partner closely with marketing peers to develop personalization strategies tailored for email touchpoints  Work closely with engineering counterparts to identify and propose solutions to infrastructure limitations  Leverage Wayfairâs proprietary data set to scope challenges and opportunities  Work closely with Engineering partners to help bring models into production that satisfy specific SLA requirements  Innovate with new approaches, staying abreast of current research in the recommendations field and the broader machine-learning community   What Youâll Need   4+ years of experience in a quantitative or technical work environment with BS/MS or advanced degree (PhD) in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, physics, neuroscience, operations research, etc.)  5-10 years of experience in a corporate, start-up, or research environment  3+ years experience with advanced programming languages and big data/ distributed system tools like Python, R, Scala, Java, Hive, SQL, Spark, etc  3+ years of professional machine learning experience (such as supervised/unsupervised learning, recommendation systems, reinforcement learning, deep learning, NLP, etc.), and familiarity with recommender systems  Ability to effectively work with high-level business stakeholders: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts and desire to influence business decisions  An analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving difficult problems  Intellectual curiosity and a desire to always be learning!  About Wayfair Inc.  Wayfair is one of the worldâs largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, weâre reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If youâre looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then youâll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.  No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. Weâre a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair â and world â for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. Thatâs why weâre proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Job Description Protection Engineering Consultants (PEC) is a unique and diverse small-business engineering firm, headquartered in Central Texas. PECâs services range from security consulting and risk mitigation support to the design, research, analysis and testing of protective structures subject to extreme loads, such as weapons effects, blast, vehicle impact, forced entry attack and natural hazards. We provide structural and mechanical engineering services; use machine learning (ML) and uncertainty quantification (UQ) techniques to deliver novel solutions to engineering problems; create specialized software for defense and anti-terrorism applications; perform advanced numerical modeling; develop, oversee and perform nonlinear and dynamic testing; develop criteria for protective applications; and, provide training. We work domestically and internationally. As we continue to expand our services, PEC is looking for a creative coding-capable engineer or computer scientist to support the development of novel ML algorithms that address the unique engineering challenges of our military and civilian clients. Preferred areas of expertise include data engineering, machine learning, data visualization, and computer vision. Other areas of value include deep learning, database management, cloud computing, and knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git Lab). The successful candidate will be proficient with Python and be able to develop novel solutions from prototyping through software integration. Your role initially will be to provide support for our ongoing efforts. We will provide opportunities for you to grow into project management, marketing, and business development, as your interests dictate; you can also stay in a technical role if that is your preferred career path. Qualifications BS, MS or PhD (Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Information Systems, or a related field). No professional experience required (3-5 years of experience applying data science and ML techniques to solve real-world problems a plus). Proficiency in Python (C++, SQL, and Ruby a plus). US citizen. Ability to clearly communicate verbal and written technical information. Benefits PEC offers a competitive compensation package for the successful candidate. Benefits include: Competitive salary. Flexible work schedule. Location in a dynamic and vibrant Texas community. Relocation expenses. Annual performance bonuses. Opportunity for company ownership. Professional development and training support. Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance paid in full. 401(k) match plan. Company Description    Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiantâs approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats.           Job Description    The Data Science team develops innovative, data-driven solutions to todayâs most challenging cybersecurity problems. By leveraging data derived from our companyâs unparalleled view of the threat landscape, the Data Science team provides solutions with significant impact for our customers and the broader cybersecurity industry.     We are looking for a highly-motivated Data Scientist to help us solve these problems by applying their expert knowledge of machine learning and statistics. An ideal candidate will have previous exposure in applying machine learning and statistical techniques to cybersecurity problems, have first-hand experience building models and analytic products that have been deployed to customers. Astera Labs Inc., a fabless semiconductor company headquartered in the heart of California's Silicon Valley, is a leader in purpose-built connectivity solutions for data-centric systems throughout the data center. Partnering with leading processor vendors, cloud service providers, seasoned investors, and world-class manufacturing companies, Astera Labs is helping customers remove performance bottlenecks in data-intensive systems that are limiting the true potential of applications such as artificial intelligence and machine learning. The company's product portfolio includes system-aware semiconductor integrated circuits, boards, and services to enable robust CXL, PCIe, and Ethernet connectivity. Job Description  As an Astera Labs Product Application Engineer, you will be part of a team that designs-in and supports Astera Labs' portfolio of connectivity products in the world's leading cloud service providers, server and network OEMs. In this role, you will need to provide technical guidance to customers to overcome design challenges, generate collateral for existing and new products, and drive innovation by providing insightful feedback to other internal teams to continuously improve products and processes. There are opportunities to support key customers directly, and also to dive deep in the lab to address the challenges associated with leading edge semiconductor products.  Basic Qualifications  Strong academic and technical background in electrical engineering. At minimum, a Bachelor's in EE is required, Master's is preferred.  Minimum of 3 years' experience working with Cloud service providers, server, or network OEM customers to design in complex SoC/silicon products for Server, Storage, and/or Networking applications.  Entrepreneurial, open-mind behavior and can-do attitude. Think and act with the customer in mind!  Required Experience  Hands-on, thorough knowledge of NRZ/PAM4 SerDes-based protocols like PCIe, Ethernet (25G and above), etc. and/or memory interfaces such as (LP)DDR5/4/3.  Silicon/System bring-up and debug experience in customer systems.  Firsthand experience with lab equipment including traffic generators, analyzers, and high-speed oscilloscopes.  A strong background in high-speed board design techniques, and understanding of Data Center systems like Servers, JBOGs/JBODs, Networking switches/routers/interconnects etc.  Technical writing skills to generate clear, precise documentation including datasheets, application notes, and similar guides for internal and customer-facing audiences.  Preferred Experience  Development/support for PCIe or Ethernet Switch products.  Working with silicon characterization/validation teams to ensure device performance is readily achievable in customer systems.  Firmware development with C-language, scripting with Python or other equivalent programming languages.  Knowledge of simulation/modeling, schematic capture, and PCB layout tools from Cadence, Altium and others.  Knowledge of simulation tools such as Keysight ADS, SiSoft QCD, etc. for IBIS-AMI analysis.  We know that creativity and innovation happen more often when teams include diverse ideas, backgrounds, and experiences, and we actively encourage everyone with relevant experience to apply, including people of color, LGBTQ+ and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities.

Meta is seeking a Research Engineer, Hardware to join the Capacity Engineering & Analysis team to focus on performance, architecture and capacity of future hardware designs. This person would be required to work cross-functionally with a number of teams to ensure efficient operation and growth of our computing resources from both a cost and technology perspective.    Research Engineer, Hardware (PhD) Responsibilities:  Explore and develop novel solutions to scale one of the largest data center capacities in the world: work with Services, Product, Data, and Infrastructure teams to scale the data center infrastructure including tens of billions of user requests, hundreds of petabytes of data, and thousands of giga bps of network flow. Perform research and make recommendations aimed at tackling state-of-the-art hardware and software performance issues (e.g. optimize hardware and software architectures, improve product/service performance, reduce resource consumption and shorten request latency, etc.). Provide deep visibility into Meta products and services: Run capacity and performance experiments to determine scaling and utilization parameters for various service tiers. Collaborate with wider Infrastructure teams to land improvements to server and network hardware and optimizer software architecture.    Minimum Qualifications:  Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Operations Research or related field. Publications in conferences/journals or experience in artificial intelligence, machine learning, computer architecture, operating systems, data center technologies, performance analysis, workload characterization, or related field. Experience in leveraging theoretical and empirical research to solve problems. Experience in communicating complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner. Coding and scripting proficiency. Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment. Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta.    Preferred Qualifications:  Research experience in one or more of the following areas - Distributed storage systems, optimizing AI/ML systems and traditional (Caches, Databases) distributed applications. Expertise with analysis and conducting performance characterization of distributed systems with focus on hardware and software co-design. Understanding of hardware architecture of one or more key hardware components such as CPU, GPU, Memory, Flash, or related. Experience with Voice platforms or Natural Language Processing technologies Experience with anomaly detection, analysis of high volume metrics, recommender, or search systems. job_title: Senior Engineer - Opportunity for Working Remotely Dallas, TX
job_Description: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?     VMware is a leader in virtualization solutions that enables our enterprise customers in powering their public and private cloud infrastructures.        VMware vSphereÂ® VMFS (Virtual Machine File System) is a high-performance cluster file system that enables virtualization to scale beyond the boundaries of a single system. Working with VMFS Team you will be part of team building next generation distributed file system for a virtualization platform. You will be engaged in designing, implementation, problem-solving and troubleshooting of building scalable file system as an infrastructure component for both on-premises and cloud solution.     If you are passionate about system programming, virtualization, distributed systems, building a scalable and performant platform, storage, and snapshot technologies you will feel right at home.     If you are looking forward to work on the latest technology related to building cloud infrastructure and want to have experience of file system and kernel internal then this is the place.        Success in the Role:   What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing ?     Within your first 6 months         You will be expected to have good understanding of architecture and design of VMFS (Virtual Machine File System) and overall knowledge of storage stack and IO path of VMware vSphere product.      You will participate in design discussions and feature development activities for the next version of VMFS.      You will be making code changes of low quantum to understand overall development process.           After 6 months+         You will be responsible for designing and delivering solutions for various VMFS requirements.      You will be responsible for addressing feature enhancement or issue resolution in VMFS as part of bigger feature or ask by end customer.      You will be regularly evaluated on the quality of the product you create and the code you write to ensure continued advancement of your technical skills in an environment that looks to expand them.      As a member of the VMFS team you are expected to interact with other engineering groups and groups outside of engineering in helping analyze and prioritize product features. You are expected to interact with support team, partners and with key VMware technical leaders to influence and execute next generation VMFS.           What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?     Your regular activities may be modified to suit your professional strengths, however you can expect a variety of the following assignments:            Design and develop distributed file system components to support for higher scale and performance. This will involve utilizing C programming skills and Operating System Programming.      Work on delivering features that help VMFS file system ideal for hyperscaler and cloud platforms.      Resolve issues or work on enhancement related to file system snapshot technology.      Resolving complex software defects, including reproducing problems based on written descriptions, applying relevant techniques to isolate root cause, tracing through large source code bases, and writing long-term fixes as well as short-term workarounds.      Work with VMware kernel, core storage and management teams to ensure that features work seamlessly end-to-end and maintain product extensibility and compatibility           What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?     This position reports to the Manager of the VMFS File system Team, an experienced software engineer and manager who has many years of engineering and management experience.     The team consists of highly competent senior engineers, kernel, and file system experts. We focus on iterative development, both of software and our software development practices.     You will be part of the File system team that runs on majority of the vSphere installation around the globe.        Where is this role located?     Flexible: The role is considered flexible and will be a mix of working from a local VMware office in US and remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager.        What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?     You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.            Employee Stock Purchase Plan      Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types      Generous Time Off Programs      40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community      Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities      Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)      Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes           Category :  Engineering and Technology   Subcategory:  Software Engineering   Experience:  Business Leadership   Full Time/ Part Time:  Full Time   Posted Date:  2022-04-04     VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape whatâs possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.        Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Astera Labs Inc., a fabless semiconductor company headquartered in the heart of California's Silicon Valley, is a leader in purpose-built connectivity solutions for data-centric systems throughout the data center. Partnering with leading processor vendors, cloud service providers, seasoned investors, and world-class manufacturing companies, Astera Labs is helping customers remove performance bottlenecks in data-intensive systems that are limiting the true potential of applications such as artificial intelligence and machine learning. The company's product portfolio includes system-aware semiconductor integrated circuits, boards, and services to enable robust CXL, PCIe, and Ethernet connectivity. Job Summary  To support rapid international business growth, we are hiring a Sr. Product Manager who has experience developing hardware products for high-speed communication protocols like PCIe, CXL, Ethernet, DDR, NVMe, etc. As an Astera Labs Sr. Product Manager, you will lead product definition, vision, and launch for products. You will lead interactions with engineering teams, lead customer discussions, develop go-to-market strategies, and work with senior leaders on the vision and customer impact.  Basic Qualifications  Engineering Bachelor's degree, preferred MBA, or advanced degree  Minimum of 5 years' experience working in product management, product marketing, or business development.  Experience with hardware or module product delivery for high-speed connectivity applications  Excellent communication, both written and verbal, with the ability to influence across senior leadership teams  Detail oriented with a passion for telling a compelling story  Authorized to work in the US and start immediately.  Required Experience  Must have thorough market knowledge of server, storage, cloud, and data center segment  Proficient technical knowledge of the following high-speed interfaces: PCIe, CXL, Ethernet, DDR, and NVMe  Direct experience with roadmap strategy, product tradeoffs, and product definition for PCIe, Ethernet, and Memory solutions  Demonstrated ability to grow product revenue for module solutions and/or semiconductor products  Proven track record of working closely with cloud service providers, data center OEMs/ODMs, and memory and CPU/GPU vendors.  Partnered with industry ecosystem and standards organizations such as CXL Consortium, PCI-SIG, etc.  Responsibilities  Define Product Visions  for both short-term and long-term strategies and roadmap including definition and prioritization of features that are aligned with customer requirements.  Maximize Business Impact  through continuous market assessment. Refine product, when needed, based on new learnings and as an advocated for the customer  Drive strategic engagements  with partners and be able to influence key decision makers to align on vision through excellent written and verbal communication of product value proposition.  Develop Go-to-market strategy  and launch plan with clear market assessment, competitive analysis, and positioning of products  Execute on product development  by working with program management and engineers to implement the GTM and business plan  Lead and build cross functional relationships  across engineering, sales, and other key stakeholders  We know that creativity and innovation happen more often when teams include diverse ideas, backgrounds, and experiences, and we actively encourage everyone with relevant experience to apply, including people of color, LGBTQ+ and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities.
